title: Fans' pay-per-view boycott raises £300,000 - but scheme to continue into next month
description: Premier League fans boycotting pay-per-view games raise almost £300,000 for charity - but the controversial TV scheme is set to continue.

title: 'We can do something special' - but are Kane and Son the best Premier League partnership ever?
description: Tottenham striker Harry Kane says "we can do something special" as his brilliant partnership with Son Heung-min earns a 1-0 win over Burnley.

title: Who was 'nothing short of brilliant' to make Garth Crooks' team of the week?
description: Which striker has shown he can do it in the Premier League? And who is in danger of being too greedy? Read Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: US Election 2020: Trump's border wall and the battle over immigration
description: Will Trump’s promise to build a wall along the Mexico border help or hinder his attempt to win four more years?

title: Free school meals: How many children can claim them?
description: The government is facing increased pressure to provide free school meals over the holidays.

title: Covid: Melbourne's hard-won success after a marathon lockdown
description: After losing its initial grip on Covid, Australia is again being hailed as a global success story.

title: England call flanker Willis & fly-half Umaga into squad for autumn matches
description: Wasps flanker Jack Willis is rewarded for his outstanding form with a call-up to the England squad for Saturday's Six Nations finale and the Autumn Nations Cup.

title: School meals: Row continues as half-term begins in England
description: Businesses across England are giving out meal packages to those in need as the government refuses to budge.

title: Wales lockdown: Shopper told period products 'not essential'
description: Tesco has apologised for saying it was unable to sell them under Welsh lockdown rules.

title: Tanker stowaways: ‘Hijacking’ ends after special forces storm ship
description: Seven stowaways, believed to be Nigerians seeking asylum, were handed over to Hampshire Police.

title: Troubles legacy proposals unhelpful, say MPs
description: Members of the NI Affairs Committee are "dismayed" at a lack of consultation over government plans.

title: Geoghegan Hart leading way for new generation, says Brailsford
description: Giro d'Italia winner Tao Geoghegan Hart is "leading the way" for a new generation of young cyclists, his Ineos Grenadiers team boss Sir Dave Brailsford says.

title: 'I saw a big, white ghost dog in a haunted house'
description: The actor reveals a spooky encounter as he takes on his first lead TV role in ITV's scary new drama.

title: School meals: 'I remember going to bed with hunger pains'
description: A woman who grew up relying on free school meals says "hunger doesn't go" in the holidays.

title: Post Office says a third of its cash machines will close
description: The move raises concerns that rural and deprived communities face being cut off from access to cash.

title: Australia seeks Qatar response after female passengers strip-searched
description: Women were examined without consent at a Qatar airport after an abandoned baby was found, witnesses say.

title: Boots to offer 12-minute Covid nasal swab test
description: The £120 nasal swab test will be available to people not showing any symptoms.

title: Frank Bough: Former Grandstand and Breakfast Time presenter dies aged 87
description: The former Grandstand presenter was one of the most familiar faces on BBC television from the 1960 to '80s.

title: The explosive problem of 'zombie' batteries
description: Batteries that power mobile phones and other devices are causing fires because they are not disposed of properly.

title: Stokes on coping with fame, life in quarantine & unearthing future England stars
description: Ben Stokes reflects on life during the coronavirus pandemic, how he copes with being in the public eye and the pivotal role he can play in unearthing future England stars.

title: 'Why Sturridge does not deserve his label as a problem player' - Micah Richards analysis
description: Micah Richards says the reason Daniel Sturridge is without a club is his reputation of having a bad attitude - but it is completely unfair.

title: Mother and baby units: 'It's our job to keep them safe'
description: Units for new mothers and women with serious mental health issues are facing unique challenges.

title: Prue Leith: NHS can serve 'delicious' food on a budget
description: Prue Leith leads a review into hospital meals, suggesting digital menus and 24 hour food service.

title: US election 2020: What the US election will mean for the UK
description: After four ragged years, the relationship is unlikely to improve no matter who sits in the White House.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'We blame Eat Out To Help Out for our tragedy'
description: Covid's second wave has hit one part of south Bradford badly, and residents have an idea where the problem began.

description: Devi Nurjandoa survived Covid but is now having to adjust to a new way of life.

title: Egypt sex attacks fuel 'feminist revolution'
description: Women and girls are fighting back against sexual harassment like never before.

title: Black and Welsh: The assumptions and questions people face
description: People share the assumptions and questions they face over their identity.

title: US election: 'Help! Everyone around me disagrees with my politics'
description: Paul and Kayleah live in two different political bubbles, but they've found a place to vent online.

title: Coronavirus: How my mum became a conspiracy theory influencer
description: Sebastian’s mum has grown a big online following by spreading dangerous Covid conspiracy theories.

description: Some children who fell seriously ill in Malaysia when they inhaled toxic gases in 2019 say they are still suffering.

title: 'Generation Covid' hit hard by the pandemic, research reveals
